subject: RE: [junit] Testing Private Methods
msgSnippet: The web site says it enhances junit 3.2. junit is now at 3.7 (I believe). Anyone knows the differences between the two ? Why can t we just have a single junit
messageBody:
The web site says it enhances junit 3.2.
junit is now at 3.7 (I believe). Anyone knows the differences
between the two ? Why can't we just have a single junit with
the best of the features ?

Thanh

> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Stetic [mailto:johns@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 28, 2001 9:12 AM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [junit] Testing Private Methods
>
>
> Mike,
> I think this may help you out.
>
> http://www.extreme-java.de/junitx/junitx.html
>
> John
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Witters [mailto:mikew@...]
> Sent: June 28, 2001 9:06 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Testing Private Methods
>
>
> Hello.
>
> Can anyone point me to a good source of information on using JUNIT for
> testing private methods and package-protected methods. It
> seems like its
> not going to be possible to do it while separating the
> TestCase classes and
> the business object classes.
>
> One of the reasons I see a difficulty is that we are using
> VisualAge for
> Java and it would make it a deployment nightmare to include
> the code in the
> same packages or, worse yet, the same classes. I know that there are
> options I could use outside of VA such as ANT to only build
> certain classes,
> but I doubt I could get the client to buy into that and I
> still don't think
> that solves the private method issue.
>
> Am I just missing something easy or what?
>
> Thanks,
> Mike
>
